content: northern diamond square ©torunjohansson northern diamond square ©torunjohansson this square can be worked in one or more colors if you use a background color a and a contrasting color b for the diamond shape a circle will appear the last page of this pattern includes the extended version with four extra rounds suggested materials just about any yarn will work with this pattern choose an appropriate hook size to go with your yarn in my examples i have used - scheepjes stonewashed and 4 mm hook 11x11cm sqaure - scheepjes catona and 3mm hook 9x9cm square stitches used standard us crochet terms chain = chain single_crochet = single_crochet double_crochet = double_crochet slip_stitch = slip_stitch treble_crochet = treble stitch fpdtr2tog = front post treble_crochet 2 together for the extended version bpdc = back post double_crochet half_double_crochet = half_double_crochet special stitches fpdtr2tog yarn over 3 times insert hook from front to back around indicated stitch yarn over and pull up a loop you ll have 5 loops on the hook yarn over and pull through 2 loops repeat two more times you ll have 2 loops left on your hook yarn over 3 times insert hook from front to back around next indicated stitch yarn over and pull up a loop you ll have 6 loops on the hook yarn over and pull through 2 loops repeat two more times you ll have 3 loops left on the hook yarn over and pull through all three remaining loops 2 to begin using color a start with a magic_ring or chain 4 and join with a slip_stitch in first chain to make a ring round 1 chain 3 counts as first double_crochet 2 double_crochet into ring chain 2 *3 double_crochet chain 2 into ring* repeat *to* two more times join with slip_stitch in 3rd chain of first chain 3 round 2 chain 3 = double_crochet double_crochet in next 2 stitches work 2 double_crochet chain 2 2 double_crochet in chain space *double_crochet in next 3 stitches work 2 double_crochet chain 2 2 double_crochet in chain space* repeat *to* two more times join with slip_stitch in 3rd chain of first chain 3 7dc/side round 3 chain 3 = double_crochet double_crochet in next 4 stitches work 2 double_crochet chain 2 2 double_crochet in chain space *double_crochet in next 7 stitches work 2 double_crochet chain 2 2 double_crochet in chain space * repeat *-* two more times double_crochet in remaining 2 stitches join with slip_stitch into 3rd chain of first chain 3 fasten_off 11dc/side round 1 round 3 round 2 round 4 change to color b start in any corner chain space *single_crochet into corner chain space single_crochet in next 5 stitches fpdtr2tog work the first leg of the fpdtr2tog around the third double_crochet of the chain space of round 2 work the second leg of the fpdtr2tog around the second double_crochet of the next
